w21zkprrf6.directions: Take the staircase to level 2. Male's praying area is at level2, for female take another staircase beside ablution area
w21zkprrf6.name: Darul Arqam
w21zkprrf6.provision: Prayer Mat, Telekung, Sarong, Songkok, Perfume, Mirror
w21zkprrf6.remarks: Segregated male and female praying area. Ablution place is provided.

w21zkr0upe.name: Khalid Mosque
w21zkr0upe.remarks: First built in 1917, this old generation masjid underwent several restorations, the most recent one in 1998. Located in the Central part of the island, its newly-restored building which comes complete with a minaret at the front porch can fill up to 2500 people. Ramadan is a busy month for the mosque as an average of 800 Muslims break their fast at the mosque daily. There are regular religious classes for children and adults.

w21zkpgf7s.name: Wak Tanjong Mosque
w21zkpgf7s.remarks: A whitewashed structure has replaced the semi-wooden prayer hall in this redeveloped masjid located in the Central part of the island. The original masjid dated back to the year 1935. In 1998, the masjid was reopened after undergoing a major restructuring. It has a capacity of 500 people.

w21zkrvhfq.name: Darul Aman Mosque
w21zkrvhfq.remarks: A squarish minaret in this Mosque Building Fund masjid combines Malay architecture and Islamic art. Nominated for the prestigious Aga Khan Award in 1989 as an excellent example of tropical architecture, the masjid features the early pitched-roof structure commonly found in the Malay archipelago. Built in 1986, the masjid located in the East can accommodate up to 3,500 people. Besides madrasah classes, it is also popular venue for haj courses organized by travel agents. The masjid has since undergone a major addition and alteration project which was completed in 2005.

w21zkymxpw.name: Kampung Siglap Mosque
w21zkymxpw.remarks: Architects responsible for the design of this masjid built under Phase Two of the Mosque Building Fund have succeeded in preserving the architecture and ambience of a kampung. Originally, a small 80-year-old masjid, the new masjid in the same site was completed in 1992. Located in the East, it has a capacity of 3000 people. Besides madrasah classes, there is a Tahfiz Al-Quran center. A Centre of Family Development provides guidance and courses to enhance family life.

w21zkqh73z.directions: Take the lift to level 4, turn left and enter stair A exit door. Go up to level 5 and turn left and proceed straight to the extreme end where the musolla is located. There are signs to lead to the location.
w21zkqh73z.name: Lagun Sari at OCN Building
